page.title: 10The Domesday Book
page.content: AWRE IS MENTIONED IN THE FIRST DOMESDAY BOOK AS FIVE MANORS HELD BY THE KING.THE CHURCH HELD ONE VIRGATE OF LAND ONE FISHERY AND PRODUCED THIRTY LOADS OF SALT,PROBABLY BY EVAPORATION FROM THE SEVERN.THE CHURCH WAS REQUIRED TO PAY AS MUCH PRODUCE AS WOULD PROVIDE FOR THE MAINENANCE OF THE ROYL COURT FOR ONE NIGHT.AWRE WAS AN EARLY SETTLEMENT AT AN IMPORTANT PASSAGE ACROSS THE SEVERN.THE OLD CHURCH REGISTER RECORDS MANY MARRIAGES OF COUPLES FROM OPPOSITE SIDES OF THE RIVER.THE NAME AWRE COMES FROM THE OLD ENGLISH FORALDER TREES.ONE OLD INHABITANT TOLD US AWRE CAME FROM THE FRENCH OR FOR GOLD BECAUSE AN OLD CHIEF SAW WHEAT IN THE FIELDS.THE REGISTER OF ELECTORS HASNINE PEOPLE WITH SURNAME AWRE.THEIR FAMILY SPRINGS FROM A YOUNG BOY RESCUED FROM DROWNING IN THE SEVERN THREE HUNDRED YEARS AGO.
